summary: The diff shows only two modified files: backend/main.mo (the Motoko actor code) and project_state.json (metadata update). There is no evidence of deployment configuration â€” no dfx.json creation/modification, no canister IDs, no deployment scripts, no frontend build configuration updates for mainnet, no asset canister setup, and no ICP-specific network configuration. REQ-16 requires actually deploying to Internet Computer mainnet, which involves configuration and deployment artifacts not present in this diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Deploy the backend Motoko canister to the Internet Computer mainnet so it is publicly accessible.
missing_requirements.reason: No dfx.json, canister configuration, deployment scripts, or canister IDs indicating a mainnet deployment are present in the diff. The backend/main.mo file appears to be a code-only change with no deployment evidence.

missing_requirements.requirement: Build and upload the frontend React app as an asset canister on the Internet Computer mainnet.
missing_requirements.reason: No frontend build configuration, asset canister setup, dfx.json with frontend canister definition, or any ICP asset upload evidence is present in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: The application is accessible via a public ICP URL (e.g., https://<canister-id>.icp0.io).
missing_requirements.reason: No canister IDs, public URLs, or network deployment configuration files are present in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Internet Identity authentication functions correctly on the live deployment.
missing_requirements.reason: No Internet Identity integration configuration for mainnet (e.g., updated canister IDs referencing the mainnet Internet Identity canister) is present in the diff.
